item.title: Walking Giants
item.author: jacØb
item.description: Into the trees, they walked. Heads down, kicking rocks like giants canvasing a vast geography. They spoke nothing, feeling the silence was the fragile bond that held them together.

item.title: The Masks of M. Irani
item.author: jacØb
item.description: Was this the street? So many years since he, a frightened boy, so small and uncertain, had stumbled into this cobbletone corridor, on the surge of the colorful choas and cacophony of carnivale. The shop half as narrow as its neighbors, and mostly hidden behind climbing vines of bouganvilla had beckoned to him with the tinkle of small bells as he tripped and fell into the floral embrace. He turned the half-hidden door handle and stepped through the doorway of the Mask Shop of M.

item.title: Nothing Ever Begins
item.author: jacØb
item.description: Nothing ever begins. There is no first moment; no single word or place from which this or any story springs. The threads can always be traced back to some earlier tale, and the tales that preceded that; though as the narrator’s voice recedes the connections will seem to grow more tenuous, for each age will want the tale told as if it were of its own making. Clive Barker ~ Weaveworld

item.title: The First Breath
item.author: jacØb
item.description: In his hand he held the first breath of the universe, the initial urge, the finite moment from which the shadow of the infinite had seeped forth.
